column4: what is a good way of transfering files from a FTP to another bypassing my own computer?
using terminal ? :)

ftp is good since it will set the right user permissions etc and file owner
if you wish to use a gui client on your destination machine
look up tunnelling X over SSH
and you can use it
if your current machine is windoes you can do it with PuTTY and xming
im on ubuntu sucka..
why would I be asking in #ubuntu if I am on a win machiner
type ssh -X username@destination
then in the shell when you l og in you can type for example
graphicalftpclient &

and it will appear on your screen
